info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 07 at 6:30PM EDT until August 07 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN BROOME AND SOUTHWESTERN DELAWARE COUNTIES... At 630 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Sherman, or near Deposit, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Deposit and Sanford around 640 PM EDT. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
